forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 48. West wind around 6 mph.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, an overcast veil wraps the city, signaling the chilly embrace of the marine layer that often graces this shoreline. The temperature hovers around a cool 56 degrees, dropping gently to a crisp 54 as the day progresses. The characteristic southwest wind whispers through the streets, moving at a moderate pace, a soft reminder of the ocean's influence on the atmosphere. With the sun muted behind a thick blanket of clouds, the day carries a somewhat somber charm, ideal for reflective walks along the waterfront or quiet sips of coffee in cozy corner cafés.

Tonight, the clouds will persist, ushering in a slight dip to around 48 degrees, inviting layers that indulge both comfort and warmth. A light west wind accompanies the evening, perfect for stargazers with a penchant for crisp, clear nights. For those venturing outside, a jacket will be your best companion—a practical choice to shield against the chill as you explore local art galleries or join friends for intimate conversations in well-lit bars. While the fog may obscure distant views, it offers a unique backdrop for the city's intricate architecture and vibrant life, beckoning all to appreciate the subtleties of an afternoon drenched in soft gray tones.
